column1: '''I Sit Beside the Fire and Think''' is a song by [[Bilbo Baggins]]
column2: which he sang softly in [[Rivendell]] on [[24 December]] {{TA|3018}}
column3: <ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> the evening before the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] set out upon their quest. Bilbo sang the song in the presence of [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]
column4: after giving Frodo the ''[[mithril]]''-coat and [[Sting]].<ref>{{FR|II3}}</ref> The song is a contemplative piece
column5: sung by a now-aging hobbit recalling past events that ends in anticipation of hearing returning friends.

column1: I sit beside the fire and think
of all that I have seen
with morning mist and silver sun
I sit beside the fire and think
of how the world will be
when winter comes without a spring
For still there are so many things
in every wood in every spring
I sit beside the fire and think
and people who will see a world
But all the while I sit and think
Donald Swann wrote music for this song
column2: which can be found in the book ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'';<ref>{{RGEO|Sit}}</ref> it is also found on the accompanying CD of the latest version.
